DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the present study is to determine if spironolactone is safe and effective in the treatment of cardiovascular complications in hemodialysis patients.
DOC.brief_title: Cardiovascular Protective Effect of Spironolactone in Hemodialysis
DOC.detailed_description: Cardiovascular complications are common in dialysis patients and comprise up to 50% of deaths in end-stage renal disease population. Hypertension and left ventricle hypertrophy occur in more than 70% of patients undergoing long-term hemodialysis therapy, and both contributes to mortality and morbidity.Recent clinical trials in chronic heart failure and post miocardial infarct heart failure patients have demonstrated a beneficial effect of a mineralocorticoid receptor blocker spironolactone, in adittion to standard therapy (RALES AND EPHESUS studies). The aim of the present study is to evaluate spironolactone treatment in hemodialysis patients.
DOC.criteria: chronic hemodialysys (> 3 months) anuria (diuresis <200 mL/day) Liver failure Insulin dependent diabetes Treatment with adrenergic beta blockers or agonists Treatment with convertingenzime blocker or angiotensin receptor antagonists Cancer
